basics.name: Joel Ahn
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I am a full stack developer who naturally leans towards the front-end. Coming from an art background I can't help but try and make things visually appealing whether it be the application page or the code itself. But overall, I find myself to be a very curious person who loves to ask questions and discover new information.

work.summary: The mission of Communities In Schools of North Texas (CISNT) is to surround students with a community of support, empowering them to stay in school and achieve in life.

projects.name: Vitamin-DB
projects.summary: A personal medical information database for easy access. Video demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vEFQblKqqkI
highlights: Created the front-end with React-Redux-Thunk, Browserify, and Reactify to best manage functionality and user data.
Implemented React-bootstrap, Twilio, nodemailer to better help the user recieve their information from database
Enabled user features such as: Add, Edit, Delete, Show(a certain type of information), and Appointment reminders.

projects.name: Slandr
projects.summary: An application for users to fill out a questionnaire of current & controversial topics to debate against other users.
highlights: Designed the aesthetics and user functionality on the front-end with just Angular tools(Angular-animate[, cookies, ...]).
Created forms to input user information, which we then sent to our MySQL database.
Linked the user data from the front end to the database in which I had to work with Express, Knex, and Sqlite.

projects.name: Blue Shell
projects.summary: A bookfinder, recommender, and user reviewing website that can be shared.
highlights: Implemented a user review system for individual books that can be collectively viewed.
Web scrapped the current top 20 Amazon books for a quick and popular recommendation.
Worked with Legacy code from other devs and learned valuable lessons like: How essential it is, not just for oneself, to comment and make well readable code.
